channel.title: Can't get this
channel.description:
There is a circle with 9.25 square fathoms for its area. There is a square with the same perimeter as the circle's. There is a normal hexagon with the same area as the Square's. There is a normal pentagon with the same perimeter as the hexagon's. There is a normal octagon with the same area as the pentagon's. There is an equilateral triangle with the same perimeter as the octagon's. How many square millimeters area does the triangle have?
Someone gave it to me, don't know it realy >.>

item.title: Can't get this
item.dc:creator: @wallfire wallfire
item.description:
@wallfire wrote:

hint:

  1. a=b=c=d

  2. fathom is a unit of measure, ie. it can convert to feet, inches, meters, etc…

Read full topic
